bcid
Class elementEncoder

java.lang.Object
  bcid.elementEncoder
All Implemented Interfaces:
encoder
public class elementEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
implements encoder

The element encoder operates by equating encoded Strings directly to BigIntegers in the database. The BigIntegers in the database are used for joining and linking on the back-end. This class implements the encoders interface, taking a BigInteger and turning it into an encoded bcid String. Conversely, it can attempt taking a String and decoding it into an BigInteger.

Method Detail

encode

public java.lang.String encode(java.math.BigInteger big)
Use Base64 encoding to turn BigIntegers numbers into Strings We do this both to obfuscate integers used as identifiers and also to save some space. Base64 is not necessarily the best for compressing numbers but it is well-known The encoding presented here adds a check digit at the end of the string

Specified by:
encode in interface encoder
Parameters:
big -
Returns:
A String representation of this BigInteger

decode

public java.math.BigInteger decode(java.lang.String entireString)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Base64 decode identifiers into integer representations. 1. verify that the entire string is good w/ check digit 2. Then base64 decode just the encoded piece of the string

Specified by:
decode in interface encoder
Parameters:
entireString -
Returns:
a BigIntgeger representation of this BCID
